body.p: Selected books from this list will be reviewed in future issues.
Bakke, D. The Decision Maker. Seattle, WA: Pear Press, 2013. 205 pp. $24.95, paper.
Beattie, G. Our Racist Heart? An Exploration of Unconscious Prejudice in Everyday Life. New York: Routledge, 2013. 302 pp. No price given.
Carroll, A. B., K. J. Liparito, J. E. Post, P. H. Werhane, and K. E. Goodpaster Corporate Responsibility: The American Experience. New York: Cambridge University Press, 2012. 543 pp. $49.00, paper.
Cetina, K. K., and A. Preda The Oxford Handbook of the Sociology of Finance. New York: Oxford University Press, 2013. 608 pp. No price given.
Dashwood, H. S. The Rise of Global Corporate Responsibility: Mining and the Spread of Global Norms. New York: Cambridge University Press, 2012. 320 pp. $99.00, hardcover.
Dauvergne, P., and J. Lister Eco-business: A Big-brand Takeover of Sustainability. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press, 2013. 194 pp. $24.95 / £17.95, cloth.
DiTomaso, N. The American Non-Dilemma: Racial Inequality without Racism. New York: Russell Sage Foundation, 2012. 403 pp. $42.50, paper.
Durand, R., and J. Vergne The Pirate Organization: Lessons from the Fringes of Capitalism. Boston: Harvard Business Review Press, 2013. 191 pp. No price given.
Fairfax, S. K., L. N. Dyble, G. T. Guthey, L. Gwin, M. Moore, and J. Sokolove California Cuisine and Just Food. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press, 2012. 354 pp. $25.00, paper.
Fetterman, D. M. Empowerment Evaluation in the Digital Villages: Hewlett-Packard’s $15 Million Race toward Social Justice. Stanford, CA: Stanford University Press, 2012. 154 pp. No price given.
Forman, J. Story Telling in Business: The Authentic and Fluent Organization. Stanford, CA: Stanford University Press, 2013. 287 pp. No price given.
Fry, L. W., and M. S. Nisiewicz Maximizing the Triple Bottom Line through Spiritual Leadership. Stanford, CA: Stanford University Press, 2013. 331 pp. No price given.
Gailmard, S., and J. W. Patty Learning while Governing: Expertise and Accountability in the Executive Branch. Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 2013. 321 pp. $30.00 / £19.50, cloth.
Gibbons, R., and J. Roberts, eds. The Handbook of Organizational Economics. Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 2012. 1233 pp. $99.50 / £69.95, cloth; $99.50, e-book.
Gleeson, S. Conflicting Commitments: The Politics of Enforcing Immigrant Worker Rights in San Jose and Houston. Ithaca, NY: Cornell University Press, 2012. 272 pp. $69.95, hardcover; $24.95, paper.

Golden-Biddle, K., and J. E. Dutton, eds. Using a Positive Lens to Explore Social Change and Organizations: Building a Theoretical and Research Foundation. New York: Routledge, 2012. 541 pp. No price given.
Grant, A. Give and Take: A Revolutionary Approach to Success. New York: Viking Press, 2012. 305 pp. $27.95, hardcover.
Guillén, M., and E. Ontiveros Global Turning Points: Understanding the Challenges for Business in the 21st Century. New York: Cambridge University Press, 2012. 182 pp. $32.99, paper.
Huggin, R., and H. Izushi, eds. Competition, Competitive Advantage, and Clusters: The Ideas of Michael Porter. New York: Oxford University Press, 2012. 303 pp. $45.00, paper.
Klikauer, T. Seven Management Moralities. New York: Palgrave Macmillan, 2012. 339 pp. $105.00, hardback.
Leonardi, P. M., B. A. Nardi, and J. Kallinikos, eds. Materiality and Organizing: Social Interaction in a Technological World. New York: Oxford University Press, 2013. 365 pp. No price given.

Lomi, A., and J. R. Harrison, eds. Research in the Sociology of Organizations, vol. 36: The Garbage Can Model of Organizational Choice: Looking forward at Forty. Bingley, UK: Emerald Books, 2012. 458 pp. No price given.
Mishel, L., J. Bivens, E. Gould, and H. Shierholz The State of Working America, 12th edition. Ithaca, NY: Cornell University Press, 2012. 505 pp. $75.00 / £46.50, cloth; $24.95 / £15.50, paper.
Mitchell, D. J. B., ed. Public Jobs and Political Agenda: The Public Sector in an Era of Economic Stress. Ithaca, NY: Cornell University Press, 2012. 259 pp. $29.95, paper.
Moore, M. H. Recognizing Public Value. Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press, 2013. 473 pp. $59.95, cloth.
Rodrígues-Campos, L., and R. Rincones-Gόmez Collaborative Evaluation: Step-by-Step, 2d ed. Stanford, CA: Stanford University Press, 2013. 249 pp. No price given.
Rousseau, D. M., ed. The Oxford Handbook of Evidence-based Management. New York: Oxford University Press, 2012. 432 pp. No price given.
Rumsey, M. G., ed. The Oxford Handbook of Leadership. New York: Oxford University Press, 2013. 485 pp. No price given.
Simms, M., L. Holgate, and E. Heery Union Voices: Tactics and Tensions in UK Organizing. Ithaca, NY: Cornell University Press, 2012. 189 pp. $69.95, hardcover; $22.95, paper.
Thompson, L. Creative Conspiracy: The New Rules of Breakthrough Collaboration. Boston: Harvard Business Review Press, 2013. 231 pp. No price given.
Zheng, Y. Managing Human Resources in China: The View from inside Multinationals. New York: Cambridge University Press, 2013. 287 pp. $95.00, hardcover.
